availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Georgia native. Married to Lucinda Carroll Glenn in Livingston County, Kentucky, on April 4, 1843. Father of William G. Glenn, Elizabeth Glenn, Sarah M. Glenn, Willis C. Glenn, Robert B. Glenn, Caroline Glenn, David J. Glenn, Thomas Glenn, and James Glenn. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 303A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 821, 824.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 180.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia p. 213A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film #000318176, p. 37.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administrators Bonds, 1863-1878, p. 45.
